io.reinert.requestor.core

Interface RequestBuilder

  • All Superinterfaces:
    RequestOptions, Saver
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    PollingRequestBuilder, PollingRequestInvoker, RequestInvoker

    public interface RequestBuilder
extends RequestOptions, Saver
    A fluent request builder.
    Author:
    Danilo Reinert

      • header

        RequestBuilder header(String header,
                      String value)
        Sets a request header with the given name and value. If a header with the specified name has already been set then the new value overwrites the current value. If a null value is given, then any existing header with the given name is removed.
        Parameters:
        header - The name of the header
        value - The value of the header
        Returns:
        This building request

      • header

        RequestBuilder header(Header header)
        Sets a request header. If a header with the specified name has already been set then the new value overwrites the current value.
        Parameters:
        header - The header instance
        Returns:
        This building request

      • payload

        RequestBuilder payload(Object payload,
                       String... fields)
        Input a object to be sent in the HTTP Request payload.

        This object will be serialized considering its class and the current content-type.
        If no serializer was found by matching these two factors, then a exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        payload - The payload of the request
        fields - The fields to be serialized
        Returns:
        This building request

      • timeout

        RequestBuilder timeout(int timeoutMillis)
        Sets the number of milliseconds to wait for a request to complete. Should the request timeout, registered RejectedCallbacks will be called in the returning Request. The callback method will receive an instance of the RequestTimeoutException class as its Throwable argument.

        Negative aren't allowed according to XMLHttpRequest specification. So if a value less than zero is passed, it is ignored.

        Parameters:
        timeoutMillis - Number of milliseconds to wait before canceling the request, a value of zero disables timeouts
        Returns:
        This building request

      • delay

        RequestBuilder delay(int delayMillis)
        Delay the request dispatching in milliseconds.

        Negative aren't allowed. So if a value less than zero is passed, it is ignored.

        Parameters:
        delayMillis - The time in milliseconds to delay the request
        Returns:
        This building request

      • retry

        RequestBuilder retry(int[] delaysMillis,
                     Event... events)
        Set a retry policy for this request.

        Parameters:
        delaysMillis - The times in milliseconds to wait before each consecutive retry
        events - The events that will trigger a retry
        Returns:
        This building request

      • save

        RequestBuilder save(String key,
                    Object value)
        Saves an object associated with a key that can be later retrieved in the request processing.
        Specified by:
        save in interface Saver
        Parameters:
        key - A key to associate the data
        value - The data to be persisted
        Returns:
        This building request

      • poll

        PollingRequestBuilder poll(PollingStrategy strategy)
        Poll the request according to the specified strategy with no interval.

        The poll strategy determines whether the next request should be triggered after sending the previous one (SHORT) or after receiving its response (LONG).

        If delay is also set, then the time window between each request will be poll + delay.

        Negative aren't allowed. So if a value less than zero is passed, it is ignored.

        Parameters:
        strategy - The polling strategy
        Returns:
        This building request

      • poll

        PollingRequestBuilder poll(PollingStrategy strategy,
                           int intervalMillis)
        Poll the request according to the specified interval in milliseconds.

        The poll strategy determines whether the next request should be triggered after sending the previous one (SHORT) or after receiving its response (LONG).

        If delay is also set, then the time window between each request will be poll + delay.

        Negative aren't allowed. So if a value less than zero is passed, it is ignored.

        Parameters:
        strategy - The polling strategy
        intervalMillis - The time in milliseconds to poll the request
        Returns:
        This building request

      • poll

        PollingRequestBuilder poll(PollingStrategy strategy,
                           int intervalMillis,
                           int limit)
        Poll the request dispatching in a regular period of time in milliseconds for a limited number of times.

        The poll strategy determines whether the next request should be triggered after sending the previous one (SHORT) or after receiving its response (LONG).

        The request will automatically stop polling after being called for the limit number of times.

        If delay is also set, then the time window between each request will be pollInterval + delay.

        Negative aren't allowed. So if a value less than zero is passed, it is ignored.

        Parameters:
        strategy - The polling strategy
        intervalMillis - The time in milliseconds to poll the request
        limit - Maximum number of times the request will be polled
        Returns:
        This building request
